com.google.android.libraries.mediaframework.exoplayerextensions

Class ExoplayerWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.libraries.mediaframework.exoplayerextensions.ExoplayerWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.ChunkSampleSource.EventListener, com.google.android.exoplayer.drm.StreamingDrmSessionManager.EventListener, com.google.android.exoplayer.ExoPlayer.Listener, com.google.android.exoplayer.MediaCodecAudioTrackRenderer.EventListener, com.google.android.exoplayer.MediaCodecTrackRenderer.EventListener, com.google.android.exoplayer.MediaCodecVideoTrackRenderer.EventListener, com.google.android.exoplayer.text.TextTrackRenderer.TextRenderer, com.google.android.exoplayer.upstream.DefaultBandwidthMeter.EventListener

    public class ExoplayerWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.google.android.exoplayer.ExoPlayer.Listener, com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.ChunkSampleSource.EventListener, com.google.android.exoplayer.upstream.DefaultBandwidthMeter.EventListener, com.google.android.exoplayer.MediaCodecVideoTrackRenderer.EventListener, com.google.android.exoplayer.MediaCodecAudioTrackRenderer.EventListener, com.google.android.exoplayer.text.TextTrackRenderer.TextRenderer, com.google.android.exoplayer.drm.StreamingDrmSessionManager.EventListener
    A wrapper around ExoPlayer that provides a higher level interface. It can be prepared with one of a number of ExoplayerWrapper.RendererBuilder classes to suit different use cases (e.g. DASH, SmoothStreaming and so on).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ExoplayerWrapper.InfoListener
      A listener for debugging information.
      static interface  ExoplayerWrapper.InternalErrorListener
      A listener for internal errors.
      private class  ExoplayerWrapper.InternalRendererBuilderCallback
      Responds to a successful renderer build or an error.
      static interface  ExoplayerWrapper.PlaybackListener
      A listener for basic playback events.
      static interface  ExoplayerWrapper.RendererBuilder
      Builds renderers for the player.
      static interface  ExoplayerWrapper.RendererBuilderCallback
      A callback invoked by a ExoplayerWrapper.RendererBuilder.
      static interface  ExoplayerWrapper.TextListener
      A listener for receiving notifications of timed text.

    • Field Detail

      • RENDERER_COUNT

        public static final int RENDERER_COUNT
        Exoplayer renderers are managed in an array (the array representation is used throughout the Exoplayer library).

        There are RENDERER_COUNT elements in the array.

      • rendererBuilder

        private final ExoplayerWrapper.RendererBuilder rendererBuilder
        Responsible for loading the data from the source, processing it, and providing byte streams. By modifying the renderer builder, we can support different video formats like DASH, MP4, and SmoothStreaming.

      • player

        private final com.google.android.exoplayer.ExoPlayer player
        The underlying Exoplayer instance responsible for playing the video.

      • playerControl

        private final ObservablePlayerControl playerControl
        Used to control the playback (ex play, pause, get duration, get elapsed time, seek to time).

      • mainHandler

        private final Handler mainHandler
        Used by track renderers to send messages to the event listeners within this class.
        See Also:
        DefaultRendererBuilder.buildRenderers(com.google.android.libraries.mediaframework.exoplayerextensions.ExoplayerWrapper, com.google.android.libraries.mediaframework.exoplayerextensions.ExoplayerWrapper.RendererBuilderCallback)

      • playbackListeners

        private final java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<ExoplayerWrapper.PlaybackListener> playbackListeners
        Listeners are notified when the video size changes, when the underlying player's state changes, or when an error occurs.

      • rendererBuildingState

        private int rendererBuildingState
        States are idle, building, or built.

      • lastReportedPlaybackState

        private int lastReportedPlaybackState
        States are idle, prepared, buffering, ready, or ended. This is an integer (instead of an enum) because the Exoplayer library uses integers.

      • lastReportedPlayWhenReady

        private boolean lastReportedPlayWhenReady
        Whether the player was in a playWhenReady state the last time we checked.

        private Surface surface
        The surface on which the video is rendered.

        private com.google.android.exoplayer.TrackRenderer videoRenderer
        Renders the video data.

      • multiTrackSources

        private com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.MultiTrackChunkSource[] multiTrackSources
        Sources capable of switching between multiple available tracks, indexed by ExoplayerWrapper INDEX_* constants. May be null if there are no types with multiple tracks. An individual element may be null if it does not have multiple tracks.

      • trackNames

        private java.lang.String[][] trackNames
        The names of the available tracks, indexed by DemoPlayer INDEX_* constants. May be null if the track names are unknown. An individual element may be null if the track names are unknown for the corresponding type.

      • trackStateForType

        private int[] trackStateForType
        The state of a track at a given index (one of the TYPE_* constants).

        private ExoplayerWrapper.TextListener textListener
        Respond to text (ex subtitle or closed captioning) events.

        Respond to errors that occur in Exoplayer.

        private ExoplayerWrapper.InfoListener infoListener
        Respond to changes in media format changes, load events, bandwidth estimates, and dropped frames.

        public void setSurface(Surface surface)

      • getSurface

        public Surface getSurface()
        Returns the surface on which the video is rendered.

      • blockingClearSurface

        public void blockingClearSurface()
        Clear the video surface.

        In order to clear the surface, a message must be sent to the playback thread. To guarantee that this message is delivered, Exoplayer uses a blocking operation. Therefore, this method is blocking.

      • getTracks

        public java.lang.String[] getTracks(int type)
        Returns the name of the track at the given index.
        Parameters:
        type - The index indicating the type of video (ex TYPE_VIDEO)

        public void selectTrack(int type,
               int state)
        Change the state of a track and push it onto the surface if needed.
        Parameters:
        type - The index indicating the type of video (ex TYPE_VIDEO).
        state - Either PRIMARY_TRACK or {@link #DISABLED_TRACK).

        public void prepare()

      • onRenderers

        public void onRenderers(java.lang.String[][] trackNames,
               com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.MultiTrackChunkSource[] multiTrackSources,
               com.google.android.exoplayer.TrackRenderer[] renderers)
        Invoked with the results from a ExoplayerWrapper.RendererBuilder.
        Parameters:
        trackNames - The names of the available tracks, indexed by ExoplayerWrapper TYPE_* constants. May be null if the track names are unknown. An individual element may be null if the track names are unknown for the corresponding type.
        multiTrackSources - Sources capable of switching between multiple available tracks, indexed by ExoplayerWrapper TYPE_* constants. May be null if there are no types with multiple tracks. An individual element may be null if it does not have multiple tracks.
        renderers - Renderers indexed by ExoplayerWrapper TYPE_* constants. An individual element may be null if there do not exist tracks of the corresponding type.

        Set whether the player should begin as soon as it is setup.

        public void onPlayerStateChanged(boolean playWhenReady,
                        int state)
        Description copied from interface: com.google.android.exoplayer.ExoPlayer.Listener
        Invoked when the value returned from either ExoPlayer.getPlayWhenReady() or ExoPlayer.getPlaybackState() changes.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        playWhenReady - Whether playback will proceed when ready.
        state - One of the STATE constants defined in this class.

      • onPlayerError

        public void onPlayerError(com.google.android.exoplayer.ExoPlaybackException exception)
        Description copied from interface: com.google.android.exoplayer.ExoPlayer.Listener
        Invoked when an error occurs. The playback state will transition to ExoPlayer.STATE_IDLE immediately after this method is invoked. The player instance can still be used, and ExoPlayer.release() must still be called on the player should it no longer be required.
        Specified by:
        onPlayerError in interface com.google.android.exoplayer.ExoPlayer.Listener
        Parameters:
        exception - The error.

      • onVideoSizeChanged

        public void onVideoSizeChanged(int width,
                      int height)
        Description copied from interface: com.google.android.exoplayer.MediaCodecVideoTrackRenderer.EventListener
        Invoked each time there's a change in the size of the video being rendered.
        Specified by:
        onVideoSizeChanged in interface com.google.android.exoplayer.MediaCodecVideoTrackRenderer.EventListener
        Parameters:
        width - The video width in pixels.
        height - The video height in pixels.

      • onDroppedFrames

        public void onDroppedFrames(int count,
                   long elapsed)
        Description copied from interface: com.google.android.exoplayer.MediaCodecVideoTrackRenderer.EventListener
        Invoked to report the number of frames dropped by the renderer. Dropped frames are reported whenever the renderer is stopped having dropped frames, and optionally, whenever the count reaches a specified threshold whilst the renderer is started.
        Specified by:
        onDroppedFrames in interface com.google.android.exoplayer.MediaCodecVideoTrackRenderer.EventListener
        Parameters:
        count - The number of dropped frames.
        elapsed - The duration in milliseconds over which the frames were dropped. This duration is timed from when the renderer was started or from when dropped frames were last reported (whichever was more recent), and not from when the first of the reported drops occurred.

      • onBandwidthSample

        public void onBandwidthSample(int elapsedMs,
                     long bytes,
                     long bandwidthEstimate)
        Description copied from interface: com.google.android.exoplayer.upstream.DefaultBandwidthMeter.EventListener
        Invoked periodically to indicate that bytes have been transferred.
        Specified by:
        onBandwidthSample in interface com.google.android.exoplayer.upstream.DefaultBandwidthMeter.EventListener
        Parameters:
        elapsedMs - The time taken to transfer the bytes, in milliseconds.
        bytes - The number of bytes transferred.
        bandwidthEstimate - The estimated bandwidth in bytes/sec, or BandwidthMeter.NO_ESTIMATE if no estimate is available. Note that this estimate is typically derived from more information than bytes and elapsedMs.

      • onLoadStarted

        public void onLoadStarted(int sourceId,
                 java.lang.String formatId,
                 int trigger,
                 boolean isInitialization,
                 int mediaStartTimeMs,
                 int mediaEndTimeMs,
                 long totalBytes)
        Description copied from interface: com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.ChunkSampleSource.EventListener
        Invoked when an upstream load is started.
        Specified by:
        onLoadStarted in interface com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.ChunkSampleSource.EventListener
        Parameters:
        sourceId - The id of the reporting SampleSource.
        formatId - The format id.
        trigger - A trigger for the format selection, as specified by the ChunkSource.
        isInitialization - Whether the load is for format initialization data.
        mediaStartTimeMs - The media time of the start of the data being loaded, or -1 if this load is for initialization data.
        mediaEndTimeMs - The media time of the end of the data being loaded, or -1 if this load is for initialization data.
        totalBytes - The length of the data being loaded in bytes.

      • onDownstreamFormatChanged

        public void onDownstreamFormatChanged(int sourceId,
                             java.lang.String formatId,
                             int trigger,
                             int mediaTimeMs)
        Description copied from interface: com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.ChunkSampleSource.EventListener
        Invoked when the downstream format changes (i.e. when the format being supplied to the caller of SampleSource.readData(int, long, com.google.android.exoplayer.FormatHolder, com.google.android.exoplayer.SampleHolder, boolean) changes).
        Specified by:
        onDownstreamFormatChanged in interface com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.ChunkSampleSource.EventListener
        Parameters:
        sourceId - The id of the reporting SampleSource.
        formatId - The format id.
        trigger - The trigger specified in the corresponding upstream load, as specified by the ChunkSource.
        mediaTimeMs - The media time at which the change occurred.

      • onPlayWhenReadyCommitted

        public void onPlayWhenReadyCommitted()
        Description copied from interface: com.google.android.exoplayer.ExoPlayer.Listener
        Invoked when the current value of ExoPlayer.getPlayWhenReady() has been reflected by the internal playback thread.

        An invocation of this method will shortly follow any call to ExoPlayer.setPlayWhenReady(boolean) that changes the state. If multiple calls are made in rapid succession, then this method will be invoked only once, after the final state has been reflected.

        Specified by:
        onPlayWhenReadyCommitted in interface com.google.android.exoplayer.ExoPlayer.Listener

      • maybeReportPlayerState

        private void maybeReportPlayerState()

        private void pushSurfaceAndVideoTrack(boolean blockForSurfacePush)

        Parameters:
